analyst.problem_statement: paper.md needs to be converted to PDF for publication, but there's no automated pipeline. Manual pandoc commands exist as comments but aren't executable or integrated into CI/CD.
analyst.primary_users: Paper authors and CI/CD systems that need to generate publication-ready PDFs from paper.md
analyst.success_criteria: Running ./scripts/build_paper.sh produces a valid PDF with Eisvogel academic formatting; CI automatically generates PDFs on paper.md changes

functional_requirements.name: Build Script
functional_requirements.description: Create scripts/build_paper.sh wrapper for pandoc with XeLaTeX + Eisvogel template support
acceptance_criteria: Script fails gracefully if pandoc/xelatex missing
Script auto-installs Eisvogel template on first run

functional_requirements.name: Container Update
functional_requirements.description: Update Containerfile with pandoc and texlive packages for container-based builds
acceptance_criteria: Container size increase is reasonable (<500MB additional)

functional_requirements.name: Documentation
functional_requirements.description: Create docs/pdf-generation.md with setup and usage instructions
acceptance_criteria: Instructions work on macOS and Ubuntu

analyst.performance_requirements: PDF generation should complete in <5 minutes for ~30 page paper
analyst.constraints: Must use XeLaTeX for Unicode/font support; Eisvogel template for academic styling; Scripts must follow stdlib-only rule (no Python dependencies)
analyst.assumptions: pandoc and texlive can be installed via apt-get; Eisvogel template available from GitHub releases
